name: National Watermelon Day
description: August 3rd is the official day to celebrate the unofficial fruit of the summer -- Watermelon!

name: National Chocolate Chip Cookie Day
description: On August 4th, pour a glass of milk and enjoy American's #1 favorite cookie. Whether they're homemade or store bought, don't miss out on National Chocolate Chip Cookie Day.

name: National Oyster Day
description: Whether raw, baked, broiled, or stewed, enjoy this popular shellfish on National Oyster Day.

name: International Beer Day
description: National Beer Day was created to gather with friends, celebrate brewers, and unite the world under the banner of beer.

name: Campfire Day
description: Gather around the firepit to toast marshmallows, share spooky stories, and enjoy great company! This holidayis celebrated the first Saturday in August.

name: National Bowling Day
description: Grab your pins and your pals, August 14 is National Bowling Day. Many bowling alleys offer discounts or specials this day.

name: International Cat Day
description: Created by the International Fund for Animal Welfare, International Cat Day helps raise awareness for the protection and care of cats.

name: National Book Lovers Day
description: Cozy up with your favorite story, share your favorite literary heroes, pick up a new book from the library -- August 9 is National Book Lovers Day!

name: National Spoil Your Dog Day
description: Dogs are our best friends! This is a special day to spoil them more than we already do!

name: National Vinyl Record Day
description: National Vinyl Record day is a chance to celebrate music both new and old. On August 12, pick up a new album for your collection and support your local record store.

name: National Financial Awareness Day
description: Start saving, investing, and building up that nest egg on National Financial Awareness Day on August 14.

name: World Mosquito Day
description: More than just annoying summertime pests, mosquitoes can also spread diseases like malaria and West Nile virus.
